body: Once data is clean, it's ready for analysis; but this analysis doesn't have to use complex statistical methods. Common analysis techniques such as filtering and pivot tables can be equally as effective.
title: Filtering and pivot tables

_aboutPage.aboutCredit: This work "Filtering and pivot tables", adapted from "Filtering and pivot tables" by Open Data Institute, used under CC-BY 4.0.

_skills.outcome: Create a set of analytics for a spreadsheet

body: You may find something interesting when you are cleaning, analysing and interrogating your dataset. If this is significant, the next stage will be to communicate this to others. Data visualisations help communicate insight found in data in a quick and easy way.
title: Data visualisation techniques

_skills.outcome: Describe a number data visualisations and their usage
Choose an appropriate visualisation for data

_aboutPage.aboutCredit: This work "Data visualisation techniques", is a derivative of "Data visualisation formats" by the Open Data Institute, used under CC-BY 4.0.

_items.description: Data visualisation techniques by Open Data Institute is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International Licence

body: Picking the right visualisation is only the first part of telling effective stories. Plotting the right data in the correct way, making good use of colour and other visual cues is essential to making the story “pop out” at the audience.
title: Data visualisation best practice

_aboutPage.aboutCredit: This work "Data visualisation best practice", adapted from "Visualisation best practice" by Open Data Institute, used under CC-BY 4.0.

_skills.outcome: Describe how the human brain interprets visually presented data
Use colour and pop-out to help clearly present information

body: This module explores digital maps: how open data can enhance maps; how to use maps in web sites and projects; and how to visualise and explore data with them.
title: Mapping open data

_aboutPage.aboutCredit: This work "Mapping open data", is a derivative of "Mapping open data" by Tanzania Data Lab / Open Data Institute, used under CC-BY 4.0.

_skills.outcome: Explain the benefits of open mapping
Select the appropriate technique to describe something on a map
Create a number of different maps from open data

body: Data visualisations can be a powerful way of bringing data to life, and help others deduce meaning from data. But a data visualisation on its own is rarely enough to convey the whole story in a memorable way. This module looks at how an engaging narrative can bring a story to life.
title: Narrating your story

_aboutPage.aboutCredit: This work "Narrating your story", adapted from "Narrating your story" by Open Data Institute, used under CC-BY 4.0.

_skills.outcome: List the steps writing a narrative
Identify techniques to help share your story

body: The use of visual deception can create intrigue, but it can also be used to mislead. You should be able to choose deception techniques that engage and inform, and avoid those which intentionally mislead.
title: Visual deception

_aboutPage.aboutCredit: This work "Visual deception", adapted from "Visual deception" by Open Data Institute, used under CC-BY 4.0.

_skills.outcome: Identify a number of deception techniques in visulisations
